archive.description: You are required to validate the flight status using available tools before invoking the search_direct_flight tool. Specifically, flights can only be booked when their status is 'available', indicating that seats and pricing are available. Ensure this check is performed to abide by the booking requirements, which state that flights can only be booked when their status is 'available'.
references: If the status is 'available', the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.

archive.policy_name: Flight Booking Denied for Specific Statuses
archive.description: The agent must ensure using ToolX that all flight bookings are only processed for flights with a status of 'available'. Flights with statuses 'delayed', 'on time', or 'flying' cannot be booked. This requires the use of the 'get_flight_status' tool to cross-check the flight status before booking with ToolX.
references: If the status is 'delayed' or 'on time', the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
If the status is 'flying', the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

The policy description needs improvement to specifically mention that ToolX can search direct flights only when they have an 'available' status. The score reflects the need for improved clarity and connection with actionable steps.
